page.title: 05R.A.F. COSFORD
page.content: R.A.F.Cosford is a village in itself and provides many of the services for its people.About 3000 trainee airmen and instructors live on the camp.With- in the area covered by the study are numerous workshops,training centres, churches,many of the services e.g hair dressers,dentists etc, civilian units, and sporting facilities that the base requires.The base itself including the runways and hangars is spread over an area of 700 acres.It was opened in 1938 and used for training technicians for the war(some 70000 passing through in that time.)Between 1939 and 1956 a Maintainance Unit was established and was joined by an Officers School and a School of P.E.Today its main function is that of a Communications,Electonics and Photographic School.The Hospital that was attached to the base and also served the local area closed in 1977.
